problem_summary_simple: Find the k-th largest element in an unsorted array.
problem_summary_technical: Use Quickselect (average O(n)) or a min-heap of size k (O(n log k)) to find the k-th largest element.
key_insights: The problem can be solved efficiently without full sorting.
Quickselect is an adaptation of Quicksort that partitions the array around a pivot and recursively searches only one side.
Alternatively, maintaining a min-heap of size k allows finding the k-th largest element by keeping track of the k largest seen so far.
